author: Special Correspondent
text:
With the DMDK maintaining silence over electoral alliance for the Assembly polls, BJP State president Tamilisai Soundararajan, on Thursday, met Leader of the Opposition Vijayakant in a discussion that lasted close to an hour. While Ms. Tamilisai said the meeting was to invite him to her son’s wedding scheduled for second week of February, BJP sources added that Mr. Vijayakant may have been invited to the public meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to address on February 2 in Coimbatore.

Mr. Vijayakant's wife Premalatha was present at the meeting that took place at their residence. A senior leader said the wedding would be a crucial event since BJP national president Amit Shah was expected to attend it. “It could turn out to be an opportunity to meet the erstwhile alliance leaders of DMDK and PMK and arrive at a solution for the current deadlock,” the leader added.
title: Tamilisai meets Vijayakant
